title: Sad
preview: Comfort and hope when your heart feels heavy.
reminder: Sadness is a natural part of the human experience. Even the Prophet ï·º experienced deep sorrow. Allah is Al-Wadud (The Most Loving) and He is closer to you than your jugular vein. Your tears are not unseen, and your pain is not forgotten.

quran.text: Verily, with hardship comes ease. Verily, with hardship comes ease.

dua.transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-hammi wal-hazan

actions: Make wudu and pray two rak'ahs, pouring your heart out in sujood
Write down three things you're grateful for, even if small
Step outside for fresh air and reflect on Allah's creation
Reach out to someone who loves you - connection heals
Listen to Surah Ad-Duha with translation and let it comfort you

title: Anxious
preview: Finding peace when worry overwhelms your mind.
reminder: Anxiety often comes from trying to control what is beyond our control. Remember that Allah is Al-Wakeel (The Trustee). He has already written your story, and He is the best of planners. You can let go because He never does.

quran.text: And whoever puts their trust in Allah, He will be enough for them. Indeed, Allah achieves His purpose. Allah has already set a destiny for everything.

dua.meaning: Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best Disposer of affairs.

actions: Take slow, deep breaths while saying 'SubhanAllah' with each exhale
Ground yourself by naming 5 things you can see, 4 you can touch
Write down your worries and make dua for each one
Recite Ayatul Kursi and the last two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah
Limit news and social media intake today

title: Lonely
reminder: Loneliness can feel like an endless void, but remember: Allah is Al-Qarib (The Near One). He is with you in your solitude. The Prophet ï·º found comfort in the cave of Hira, and some of the most beautiful revelations came in moments of solitude.

quran.text: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than his jugular vein.

actions: Talk to Allah as you would a close friend - He is listening
Send a message to check on someone else who might be alone
Join a local or online Islamic study circle
Volunteer at a mosque or community center
Remember: quality of connections matters more than quantity

title: Angry
preview: Channeling your anger with wisdom and patience.
reminder: Anger is a fire that can consume you or be transformed into righteous action. The Prophet ï·º taught us that true strength is not in physical power but in controlling oneself when angry. Take a moment. Breathe. Allah loves those who restrain their anger.

quran.text: Those who spend in prosperity and adversity, and those who restrain their anger and pardon peopleâ€”and Allah loves the doers of good.

dua.meaning: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the accursed.

actions: If standing, sit down. If sitting, lie down - change your state
Make wudu - water cools the fire of anger
Stay silent until the wave of anger passes
Remove yourself from the situation if possible
Ask yourself: Will this matter in 5 years? Act accordingly

title: Hopeless
preview: Rediscovering light in the darkest moments.
reminder: Hopelessness whispers that things will never get better, but this is a lie. Allah is Al-Fattah (The Opener) - He opens doors you cannot even see yet. Your story isn't over. Every prophet faced moments of despair before their greatest victories.

quran.text: Do not lose hope in the mercy of Allah, for indeed Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

dua.transliteration: La ilaha illa anta subhanaka inni kuntu minaz-zalimin

actions: Remember that dawn always follows the darkest part of night
Read about the trials of the prophets and how Allah saved them
Make a list of times when things seemed impossible but worked out
Speak to a trusted friend, family member, or counselor
Take one tiny step forward - even getting out of bed counts

title: Grateful
reminder: Gratitude is the key that opens endless blessings. When you recognize Allah's gifts, He promises to increase them. This beautiful feeling you have right now is itself a gift. Let it overflow into your actions, your words, and your worship.

quran.text: And when your Lord proclaimed: 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you in favor.'

dua.transliteration: Allahumma a'inni 'ala dhikrika wa shukrika wa husni 'ibadatik
dua.meaning: O Allah, help me to remember You, thank You, and worship You in the best manner.

actions: Pray two rak'ahs of shukr (gratitude) to Allah
Write a gratitude letter to someone who has helped you
Share your blessings - give charity, even if small
Start a gratitude journal and write 3 things daily
Express your gratitude out loud: 'Alhamdulillah for...'

title: Overwhelmed
preview: Finding clarity when everything feels like too much.
reminder: When life's demands pile up, remember that Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity. You don't have to do everything at once. Take it one moment, one breath, one task at a time. Allah is with the patient.

quran.text: Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear.

actions: Pause everything and take 10 slow, intentional breaths
Write down all tasks, then circle only the 3 most important
Say 'Bismillah' before each task - invite Allah's help
It's okay to say no or ask for help - you're human
Break big tasks into tiny steps. Focus only on the next step

title: Lost
preview: Finding your way back when life feels directionless.
reminder: Feeling lost is often the beginning of finding your true path. Allah is Al-Hadi (The Guide). He guided Ibrahim through the stars, Musa through the desert, and Muhammad ï·º through the night. He will guide you too. Just keep calling on Him.

quran.text: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.

dua.meaning: O Allah, guide me and make me steadfast.

actions: Pray Salat al-Istikhara for guidance in your decisions
Reflect on your values - what truly matters to you?
Seek advice from someone wise whom you trust
Spend time in nature and quiet reflection
Remember that detours often lead to beautiful destinations

title: Guilty
reminder: Guilt can be a gift - it shows your heart is alive and your conscience is awake. But don't let it drown you. Allah is Al-Ghaffar (The Repeatedly Forgiving). His mercy is greater than any sin. Turn back to Him. He's waiting with open arms.

quran.text: Say: O My servants who have transgressed against themselves, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

dua.transliteration: Astaghfirullaha alladhi la ilaha illa huwal hayyul qayyum wa atubu ilayh
dua.meaning: I seek forgiveness from Allah, there is no god but He, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer, and I repent to Him.

actions: Make sincere tawbah (repentance) - regret, stop, resolve
If you wronged someone, apologize and make it right if possible
Give charity as expiation and purification
Replace the bad deed with good deeds
Forgive yourself as you hope Allah forgives you

title: Afraid
preview: Finding courage and safety in Allah's protection.
reminder: Fear is natural, but remember who your Protector is. Allah is Al-Muhaymin (The Guardian). He protected the baby Musa in the river, Yunus in the whale, and the Prophet ï·º in the cave. Whatever you fear, it is under His control.

quran.text: Indeed, those who say, 'Our Lord is Allah,' and then remain steadfast - the angels will descend upon them, saying, 'Do not fear and do not grieve.'

dua.transliteration: Allahumma-hfazni min bayni yadayya wa min khalfi

actions: Recite the three Quls (Surah Ikhlas, Falaq, Nas) for protection
Recite Ayatul Kursi - the verse of protection
Name your fear specifically - it often shrinks when defined
Remember: Fear is just a feeling, not a fact about the future
Take one small brave action despite the fear

title: Jealous
preview: Transforming envy into contentment and growth.
reminder: Jealousy is a signal, not a sin - unless we act on it wrongly. It shows you what you desire. But remember: Allah distributes His blessings with perfect wisdom. What's meant for you cannot miss you. Focus on your own journey.

quran.text: And do not wish for that by which Allah has made some of you exceed others. For men is a share of what they have earned, and for women is a share of what they have earned. And ask Allah of His bounty.

dua.meaning: O Allah, I ask You from Your bounty.

actions: Make dua for the person you're jealous of - it purifies the heart
Say 'MashaAllah, Allahumma barik' when you see others' blessings
Count your own blessings - you have what others wish for too
Use the feeling as motivation to work towards your goals
Remember: comparison is the thief of joy. Run your own race

title: Peaceful
preview: Preserving and deepening your inner tranquility.
reminder: Peace of heart is one of Allah's greatest gifts. It comes not from perfect circumstances but from connection with As-Salam (The Source of Peace). Treasure this moment. Let it remind you that this peace is always available when you turn to Him.

quran.text: Verily, in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find rest.

Use this peaceful state to make heartfelt dua for others
Journal what led to this peace - create a roadmap back here
Share kindness with someone today while in this beautiful state
